solvers 1.0

    • Binomial Likelihood Benchmarks

    Binomial Likelihood Benchmarks

    Akarsh Goyal

    2020-08-26

    binomial.Rmd

    This tutorial documents the performance of the solvers for Binomial Likelihood function.

    library(solvers)
library(lattice)

    Well Conditioned Problems

    n > p

    set.seed(34)
d <- randomProblem(1000, 10, response="binomial", density = 1, rho=0)

# Obtaining fits for each solver and plotting loss vs time graph
f <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", path_length = 100)
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  52.204727819"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  42.888575166"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  149.632158386"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  211.124249861"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  4.705994649"

    # Plot for middle alpha in the path
if (f$path_length > 1) {
    data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[(f$path_length %/% 2)+1])
    plt_middle_well1 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
    update(plt_middle_well1, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))
}
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  0.405403106"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  0.426953373"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  1.627231731"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  3.428390121"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.042850411"


    # Plot for 10th alpha in the path
if (f$path_length >= 10) {
    data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[10])
    plt_10_well1 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
    update(plt_10_well1, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))
}
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  0.091226497"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  0.030998888"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  0.14591947"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  0.134028372"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.00932313"


    # Plot for last alpha in the path
data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[f$path_length])
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  1.030016717"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  1.031331882"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  3.207069538"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  5.226221664"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.103415935"
plt_last_well1 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
update(plt_last_well1, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))

    n < p

    set.seed(4)
d <- randomProblem(20, 50, response="binomial", density = 1, rho=0)

# Obtaining fits for each solver and plotting loss vs time graph
f <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", path_length = 100)
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  0.798609367"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  0.00446221"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  0.048093596"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  0.001460788"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.006288129"

    # Plot for middle alpha in the path
if (f$path_length > 1) {
    data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[(f$path_length %/% 2)+1])
    plt_middle_well2 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
    update(plt_middle_well2, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))
}

    # Plot for 10th alpha in the path
if (f$path_length >= 10) {
    data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[10])
    plt_10_well2 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
    update(plt_10_well2, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))
}

    # Plot for last alpha in the path
data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[f$path_length])
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  0.000748049"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  0.007161329"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  0.040455138"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  0.001945795"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.006169754"
plt_last_well2 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
update(plt_last_well2, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))

    Badly Conditioned Problems

    n > p

    set.seed(34)
d <- randomProblem(1000, 10, response="binomial", density = 1, rho=0.95)

# Obtaining fits for each solver and plotting loss vs time graph
f <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", path_length = 100)
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  238.120003009"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  134.521708065"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  382.413561637"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  553.35074955"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  15.291334391"

    # Plot for middle alpha in the path
if (f$path_length > 1) {
    data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[(f$path_length %/% 2)+1])
    plt_middle_bad1 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
    update(plt_middle_bad1, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))
}
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  1.509047939"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  1.424865936"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  4.213356449"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  5.043988572"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.150870619"


    # Plot for 10th alpha in the path
if (f$path_length >= 10) {
    data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[10])
    plt_10_bad1 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
    update(plt_10_bad1, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))
}
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  0.058810554"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  0.009880832"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  0.025041525"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  0.033210091"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.00279856"


    # Plot for last alpha in the path
data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[f$path_length])
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  7.802743421"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  3.118891134"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  7.633483126"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  9.114373435"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.369172129"
plt_last_bad1 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
update(plt_last_bad1, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))

    n < p

    set.seed(4)
d <- randomProblem(20, 50, response="binomial", density = 1, rho=0.95)

# Obtaining fits for each solver and plotting loss vs time graph
f <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", path_length = 100)
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  1.066706518"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  1095.55238373"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  0.152385258"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  0.01177275"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.017146548"

    # Plot for middle alpha in the path
if (f$path_length > 1) {
    data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[(f$path_length %/% 2)+1])
    plt_middle_bad2 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
    update(plt_middle_bad2, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))
}

    # Plot for 10th alpha in the path
if (f$path_length >= 10) {
    data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[10])
    plt_10_bad2 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
    update(plt_10_bad2, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))
}

    # Plot for last alpha in the path
data <- getBenchmarks(d$x, d$y, family="binomial", alpha=f$alpha[f$path_length])
#> [1] "Time taken by FISTA        :  0.00069182"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(NR)     :  1098.413160895"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(BFGS)   :  0.153671845"
#> [1] "Time taken by ADMM(L-BFGS) :  0.013408368"
#> [1] "Time taken by PN           :  0.017288724"
plt_last_bad2 <- xyplot(loss ~ time, group = solver, data = data, auto.key = list(corner = c(0.9, 0.9)), type = "l")
update(plt_last_bad2, par.settings = list(fontsize = list(text = 18)))
